page.title: 14The Leisure Centre
page.content: {The leisure centre was opened in 1977 {as part of the foreshore development. It became popular very quickly because of the wide range of activities it provided. There is something for everyone to do, from tennis, squash and bowling to weightlifting, swimming and diving. The swimming pool even has a wave machine. In March 1985 after a long debate, the council decided to put a{hydroslide}in the swimming pool. It is like a gigantic covered chute. The idea came from a leisure centre in West Germany. The hydroslide is very popular, especially with children. {It cost {Â£100,000 to build}and there was a lot of fuss when the council decided to spend all that money on one item, but now the expense is forgotten.
